result.execSummary:
The defendant John T Pospichal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Payment plan of $50.00/month commencing on 3-18-2016 and continuing to be due on the 18th of every month until paid in full. Payments made payable to the Ozaukee County Clerk of Courts.
Failure to pay will result in 1 day jail for every $25.00 outstanding.
DNA sample not required, Court waived surcharge.
